abstract: The United States should start running a federal budget surplus, and consider refinancing some of its existing debt to China.
snippet: The United States should start running a federal budget surplus, and consider refinancing some of its existing debt to China.
lead_paragraph: Cheap money from China helped create the debt-fueled investment bubble that has now burst spectacularly. Beijing’s policy of keeping its currency artificially low allowed it to rack up huge trade surpluses  cash that was recycled to help Americans live beyond their means. The Group of 20 leaders gathering in London ought to be focusing on preventing such imbalances in the future.

headline.main: Fixing Imbalances for the Long Run
